name: Good Ranger Build - LVL 20 | Aragorn or Legolas Style?
author: Deniedz

posts.author: Deniedz
posts.content:
Hi guys.
First of all I would like to congratulate you for this wonderful forum, it is so nice to see so many people still discussing and love one of the most beautiful role-playing games ever created. Thank you.

As per request, since I'm not good at building characters, if possible I would like to have a build for a server that is just being born.

The server is low magic, I don't know exactly, but I believe with maximum bonus +3 weapons. As you may have guessed, the level cap is 20, and there is only one rule, the prestige classes, if you wanted to take it, must have at least 10 levels. To be clear, the administrators want to avoid taking for example 1 level of shadowdancer just to have the advantage of hips.

That said, the class I love most, especially for roleplay is the Ranger, but let's say that the forest classes have more fun. I really like the style of Legolas, with bow and double swords if necessary, but I am open to any suggestions. Even to a druid fighter maybe.

As a good elf I hate dwarves, and I prefer the race to be human or elven.
I'm a purist, I don't even like classes based on dexterity with sword and shield or in general shields.
Do you think you can make a good build?
Ah, even a coffee thanks. : D: D Joke, sorry for too many requests.

Thank you all for your attention! <3

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Deniedz wrote:
Mar 17, 2020
Yes, I had seen this, but use a full plate and a war hammer and a tower shield lol ... it's not really in my style: D
Mick does say in his build that you can choose any other one-handed melee weapon ('though obviously not from the exotic range), so a scimitar or longsword is equally viable. You also don't need to don heavy armour or wear a shield, but that might be more of an issue, as your AC will be severely gimped in melee. Equally, I'm not sure dropping a level of Fighter would be better than dropping one of Bard. With one you lose a bonus feat, with the other your skills dumps will be further apart and you lose a level of song. Hmm...

If you'd prefer a Ranger dex build who both shoots and dual-wields you also run into issues. Yes, your archery will be better and so will your natural AC, but the number of feats at your disposal will be sorely diminished. You'll have 7. That will cover Weapon Finesse (to improve your melee AB), 2 Weapon Focuses (Longbow and Shortsword are your best bet), Blind Fight, Knockdown, and probably Improved Critical in both your chosen weapons. That's 7, and you lose out on Improved Knockdown. You'd also need at least 9 levels of Ranger to get ITWF, and if you want AA, then that leaves 1 level to qualify for the class. If, as I presume, you'd prefer Elf, then you'd need to take Wizard to avoid an xp penalty, which would mean any Tumble AC would have to be cross-classed, so ending in +2AC rather than +4. Also, with no Uncanny Dodge or Evasion you're particularly susceptible to sneaks, which is a huge bummer in Dex builds.

You present a worthy challenge, Deniedz! We'll work on it...

Oh, and welcome to the Guild!

Cheers

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Well, Ranger is a class one either exploits for TWF when one does not have the Dex to do it, or for Spell Focus reasons.

OR

One invests heavily into it, to get the best out of it.

That's my train of thought on the Ranger Class (which I love, but alas, poor Ranger Class, you get no love!)

In a low magic environment, however, the Ranger does have alot to offer - especially in the spells department (and the Animal Companion).  This change rather slantedly towards going full Ranger (when one has only 20 levels).

As an Elf, you will have a natural affinity for Dex, which is not a bad thing at all for an Archer.  It's just that Rangers make terrible Archers.  But in an environment like the one you have described, it should actually shine (I rather suspect the Barb is going to be awesome as well).

It can go bow, it can do twf, it can go sword and board.  Choosing the right Animal Companion is probably going to be the hardest part - because do you go full in with a Bear or Wolf to distract the m0bs from your Ranger, or do you aggro the mobs to you and let your mighty stealth Panther rip them to shreds with sneaks?

It's a tough decision.

I personally would go Panther, give it GMF, Cat's Grace, some Freedom, and lay down some Grease and Entangle, and lure the enemy to you with a bow, and then tell your Panther to rip them up!

Should work out pretty well.

You will have an FE bonus of +5 damage to FEs to really lay the hurt down, and it is not weapon specific (meaning it will work with your bow and with the shortsword(s) ) - to that you will have 5 of them, which should get most of the "good ones" in there (good ones being those which are prevalent and/or crit and sneak immune, as the case may be).

I think at that level, your spells may even be non-dispellable - though since the opponents could be over 20 (and some probably will be), that may not always apply.

All-in-all, in an environment such as yours, trying to remain faithful to what you are looking for, Ranger may just be the ideal choice.
